santu nand wrote:

> Hi Peter,
> Thanks a lot.
> 
> 
> But i have a doubt.Instead of fail in the below exampe we can also write
> 
> AssertTrue(2<1); //This will always fail.

Why write assertTrue(2<1); when you could simply write

if (!(2<1)) throw new AssertionFailedError();

...or even better, write the bytecode directly!

More directly, code should be clear, and assertTrue(2<1) is absolutely 
unclear. ("Why is this 2<1 crap in the middle of my test?!")

> If this os ok what i am saying then what is is the need of a faile 
> statement.

Code should communicate.
